item.title: "DnDOne"
item.content:encoded:
Opening up a thread to start discussion and have a place to share thoughts about the new information regarding "the next evolution of dnd" and what it means for the overall shape of the wikidot.

From what I can feel, despite the marketing, is that it is intended to be a 5.5e.

My current thoughts on the matter are that, depending on how it turns out on release, we could do with a sister website? I.e., theres the Dnd5e.wikidot, and then the DnD5.5e or DnD1 or DnD[whatever] wikidot, which both would include a link and text on the frontpage along the lines of "This content is for the DnD5e/5.5e edition of the game, content from Dnd5.5e/5e can be found on our sister wiki, [Link]", reason being from the UA article is that while the content does feel compatible-ish, it might cause massive amounts of bloat for the website if a lot of PHB stuff is doubled, or sections are doubled, or whatnot. And I'd prefer to avoid bloat and unwieldyness, since what I think makes the 5ewikidot a good website is its comfortable and easy to access formatting.

Yeah, thoughts from everyone else?

(edit: thinking about feats from another post actually, the sister sites feats section might end up a whole lot cleaner if thats what we do, since feats will be organized by level, so we could probably do for them a page similiar to what we do for spells (: )
